name: Tomato Salsa without Onions
author: Susan Baker
summary: My mother-in-law loves Tex-Mex but has an onion allergy.  After several attempts, I invented an authentic tasting salsa that derives some of it's smokey flavor from the roasted pepper.  I've taken to roasting the peppers in bulk so I can always have some on hand.
directions: Place poblano pepper and garlic cloves on a medium baking sheet
Turning pepper frequently, broil at maximum distance from heat until browned, about 15 minutes
In a food processor, place roasted pepper, roasted garlic, tomatoes, cilantro, cumin, chili powder and lime juice
Process using pulse setting until an evenly chunky texture is obtained
